Chapter2 Topic of Section Text Text 2.1 Subtopic Text Text 2.1.1 Code examples output_dir <- "code_output" if (!dir.exists(output_dir)) { dir.create(output_dir) } iris %>% ggplot(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) + geom_point() + theme_bw() ggsave(file.path(output_dir, "test_ggplot2.png")) ## Saving 7 x 5 in image 2.1.2 Image examples 2.1.3 Video example Introducing Markua 2.1.4 Citation examples We can put citations at the end of a sentence like this (Xie 2016). Or multiple citations (Xie 2016, @rmarkdown2018). but they need a ; separator (Xie 2016; Xie, Allaire, and Grolemund 2018). but they need a ; separator [ \[@bookdown2016\](#bookdown2016); \[@rmarkdown2018\](#rmarkdown2018)]. In text, we can put citations like this Xie (2016). Here’s a silly example which may mess up references. library(oro.nifti) ## oro.nifti 0.11.0 img <- oro.nifti::nifti() img@.Data ## , , 1, 1 ## ## [,1] ## [1,] 0 2.2 Print out session info devtools::session_info() ## Chapter3 Uses cases for Bookdown to Leanpub

Chapter3 Uses cases for Bookdown to Leanpub fp <- knitr::fig_path() fp <- dirname(fp) fp <- paste0("images/", fp, "/") knitr::opts_chunk$set(fig.path = fp) Including a figure from the resources. This shouldn’t be an issue in the future knitr::include_graphics("resources/images/itcr_training_network.png") Figure 3.1: caption for first figure, we need multiple so make sure it works knitr::include_graphics("resources/images/itcr_training_network.png") knitr::include_graphics("resources/images/itcr_training_network.png") knitr::include_graphics("resources/images/itcr_training_network.png") knitr::include_graphics("resources/images/tools.png") knitr::include_graphics("resources/images/tools.png") (#fig:right_tools)caption for local png knitr::include_graphics("https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/e/e9/Felis_silvestris_silvestris_small_gradual_decrease_of_quality.png") Figure 3.2: caption for url png Including a figure from the resources. This shouldn’t be an issue in the future knitr::include_url("http://www.youtube.com/embed/9bZkp7q19f0?rel=0") Figure 3.3: url cap knitr::include_url("http://www.youtube.com/embed/9bZkp7q19f0?rel=0") Introducing Markua knitr::include_url("https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9bZkp7q19f0?rel=0") Figure 3.4: caption for url # define GS_ID leanbuild::include_slide("https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/12DPZgPteQBwgal6kSPP58zhPhjZ7QSPZLe3NkA8M3eo/edit#slide=id.gc87451c247_0_17", overwrite = FALSE) # define GS_ID leanbuild::include_slide("https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/12DPZgPteQBwgal6kSPP58zhPhjZ7QSPZLe3NkA8M3eo/edit#slide=id.gc87451c247_0_17", overwrite = FALSE) knitr::include_url("https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1cd434bkLer_CJ04GzpsZwzeEA9gjc5Ho6QimiHPbyEg/export/png?id=1cd434bkLer_CJ04GzpsZwzeEA9gjc5Ho6QimiHPbyEg&pageid=p")

Chapter4 Figures 4.1 Make a plot This is the same code as in chapter 2, but here we can show how setting knitr chunks helps us tidy stuff up. library(here) ## here() starts at /Users/johnmuschelli/Dropbox/Projects/DaSL_Course_Template_Bookdown library(ggplot2) library(magrittr) iris %>% ggplot(aes(Sepal.Length, Sepal.Width, color = Species)) + geom_point() + theme_bw()

About the Authors Author Name is a Blank in the Blank at the Blank. Xie, Yihui. 2016. Bookdown: Authoring Books and Technical Documents with R Markdown. Boca Raton, Florida: Chapman; Hall/CRC. https://github.com/rstudio/bookdown. Xie, Yihui, J. J. Allaire, and Garrett Grolemund. 2018. R Markdown: The Definitive Guide. Boca Raton, Florida: Chapman; Hall/CRC. https://bookdown.org/yihui/rmarkdown.
